# The Oyster Box's perfect Durban lamb curry

Discover our Executive Chef's signature lamb curry recipe to try for yourself
at home.

21 Jan 2021

Share this article

No visit to Durban is complete without enjoying an authentic curry.

Durban curries, which are usually hotter, are coloured red with tomatoes,
chilies and cayenne pepper. Expert curry makers from Durban boast that a
typical Durban Masala curry powder has about 12 different ingredients in the
blend. These include ground coriander, cinnamon, cumin, curry leaves, fennel
seed, dried chilies and cayenne pepper, as well as ginger and garlic. The
array of tasty Durban curries encompass many glorious dishes made from
chicken, prawns, fish, beef and vegetables, but the most popular choice is
lamb or mutton.

Our Executive Chef at The Oyster Box, shares his signature recipe for his lamb
curry. If you're Vegetarian, you can substitute the meat with vegetables of
your choice or perhaps paneer.

#### Ingredients:

Preparation and cooking time: 1 hour  
Serves: 4 people

  * 1kg leg of lamb or shoulder (or 1 kg chicken), cubed
  * 75ml oil
  * 1 onion, diced
  * 2 cloves
  * 2 cinnamon sticks (10 cm long)
  * 20ml medium strength masala curry powder
  * 1 teaspoon salt
  * 10ml crushed garlic and ginger
  * 4 curry leaves
  * 5ml whole fennel seeds
  * 250ml water (one cup)
  * 2 large potatoes, peeled and cut in half
  * 1 medium tomato, skinned and diced
  * Coriander (dhania) leaves for garnishing  
  

#### Method:

  1. Heat your oil and add the diced onion, cloves and cinnamon sticks.
  2. Add the masala powder mix, stir and add meat to the pot.
  3. Add salt, garlic and ginger, curry leaves and fennel seeds. Stir all ingredients together.
  4. Allow to cook on a high heat for 5 minutes. Reduce heat to medium and continue cooking for 30 minutes.
  5. As excess water and juices evaporate, add the additional cup of water, followed by the potato and tomato.
  6. When both the meat and the vegetables are cooked (approximately 30 minutes), simmer on high heat for 5 minutes.
  7. Garnish with coriander and serve with rice, roti and green salad.    
  

#### Masala curry powder mix (100g)

Our curry powder mix is a carefully guarded secret but we can share what goes
in it with you. As for the measurements - only we know!

  * Cumin
  * Coriander
  * Fennel
  * Turmeric
  * Mild Masala
  * Aniseed
  * Cinnamon
  * Medium Masala
  * Cardamom

For more recipe ideas, check out our at-home blogs for inspiration.

## Share your pictures

If you enjoyed the recipe, please don't forget to share your pictures with us
on Instagram, tagging @TheOysterBox

# Incredible curry buffet

The Curry Buffet in the Ocean Terrace Restaurant continues to attract fans
from far and wide. Set in the casual, Mediterranean-inspired Ocean Terrace,
with gorgeous views across the Indian Ocean, the impressive curry selection,
of at least 11 curries daily, includes meat, fish and vegetarian options.
Using delicate blends of spices and fresh herbs, each curry is a masterpiece
in itself.

###  Authentic flavours

Every day at least 11 curries are served, including a range of meat, fish and
vegetarian dishes, with our team of talented chefs handcrafting each curry
using raw spices and fresh herbs from local traders.

The delicate flavours of Singapore Fish Curry takes full advantage of the
bountiful fresh seafood caught by local boats, while the fiery-hot Beef
Vindaloo is a firm favourite with regulars. Vegetarians will delight in the
Vegetable Korma and Sugar-Bean Curry, while the traditional Durban Lamb Curry
has long been a signature dish of The Oyster Box.

Alongside the pots of steaming curry, traditional tandoori ovens turn out
aromatic Tandoori Chicken and piping hot naan breads, while fresh homemade
condiments include pickles, chutneys, raitas, sambals and papadums.

###  Opening hours

Monday - Thursday: Dinner only  
Friday - Sunday: Lunch and dinner  
  
Price: R 550 per person, advanced booking is essential  
Please note, our menus are not Kosher or Halaal.

Tel: +27 (0) 31 514 5000
